subject: Re: [junit] How to create data-driven tests? II!
msgSnippet: Hi all, My point is slightly different. I want to create data-driven tests assuming that the data is what defines the test case s steps! My input file would be
messageBody:
Hi all,
My point is slightly different. I want to create data-driven tests
assuming that the data is what defines the test case's steps!
My input file would be something like that:
? this
! that
? this2
? this3
! that2

And I want it to produce something like:
void Test1()
{
//do this

//assert that

//do this2

//do this3

//assert that2
}

I know I can write some script or class that parses the input file and
generates the test case class, but I want something like a single class
that does this job for me, like that of dbUnit. The problem with dbUnit
is that the data is what the test case runs on...

Thanks in advance,
Reda
--
